definition[0]: a decision that an event that was planned will not happen
example[0]: Rail passengers are fed up with cancellations and delays.
example[1]: Bad weather led to the cancellation of the game.
definition[1]: a decision to end an agreement or arrangement that you have with someone
example[2]: There is a cancellation fee of £20.
example[3]: The hotel is fully booked, but we will let you know if there are any cancellations.
definition[2]: a decision or statement that a planned activity will not happen, or that an agreement will be ended
example[4]: Britain’s aircraft industry could face more job losses after the cancellation of a £2.3 billion order.
